meanings.definition: A person who causes trouble or difficulties for others.
meanings.sent1: The troublemakers in the class were always talking loudly and distracting others.
meanings.sent2: The principal had to deal with the troublemakers who were skipping classes.
meanings.sent3: The troublemakers thought it was funny to hide their classmates' pencils.
meanings.sent4: The group of troublemakers were like storm clouds, always causing chaos wherever they went.
meanings.sent5: The troublemakers were like mischievous elves, spreading mischief around the school.

meanings.definition: Someone who creates problems or disruptions.
meanings.sent1: The troublemakers at the party kept starting arguments with everyone.
meanings.sent2: The new employee turned out to be one of the troublemakers, always late and causing issues.
meanings.sent3: The troublemakers accidentally spilled juice all over the floor during the event.
meanings.sent4: The troublemakers were like broken gears, causing the whole system to malfunction.
meanings.sent5: The troublemakers were like loud sirens, alerting everyone to their presence.
